<a id="class_CurveXYZTexture"></a>

# CurveXYZTexture

**Inherits:** [Texture2D](class_texture2d.md) **<** [Texture](class_texture.md) **<** [Resource](class_resource.md) **<** [RefCounted](class_refcounted.md) **<** [Object](class_object.md)

A 1D texture where the red, green, and blue color channels correspond to points on 3 curves.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

A 1D texture where the red, green, and blue color channels correspond to points on 3 unit [Curve](class_curve.md) resources. Compared to using separate [CurveTexture](class_curvetexture.md)\ s, this further simplifies the task of saving curves as image files.

If you only need to store one curve within a single texture, use [CurveTexture](class_curvetexture.md) instead. See also [GradientTexture1D](class_gradienttexture1d.md) and [GradientTexture2D](class_gradienttexture2d.md).

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="class_CurveXYZTexture_property_curve_x"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Curve](class_curve.md) **curve_x** [ðŸ”—](#class_CurveXYZTexture_property_curve_x)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_curve_x**\ (\ value\: [Curve](class_curve.md)\ )
- [Curve](class_curve.md) **get_curve_x**\ (\ )

The [Curve](class_curve.md) that is rendered onto the texture's red channel. Should be a unit [Curve](class_curve.md).

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_CurveXYZTexture_property_curve_y"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Curve](class_curve.md) **curve_y** [ðŸ”—](#class_CurveXYZTexture_property_curve_y)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_curve_y**\ (\ value\: [Curve](class_curve.md)\ )
- [Curve](class_curve.md) **get_curve_y**\ (\ )

The [Curve](class_curve.md) that is rendered onto the texture's green channel. Should be a unit [Curve](class_curve.md).

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_CurveXYZTexture_property_curve_z"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Curve](class_curve.md) **curve_z** [ðŸ”—](#class_CurveXYZTexture_property_curve_z)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_curve_z**\ (\ value\: [Curve](class_curve.md)\ )
- [Curve](class_curve.md) **get_curve_z**\ (\ )

The [Curve](class_curve.md) that is rendered onto the texture's blue channel. Should be a unit [Curve](class_curve.md).

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_CurveXYZTexture_property_width"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[int](class_int.md) **width** = `256` [ðŸ”—](#class_CurveXYZTexture_property_width)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_width**\ (\ value\: [int](class_int.md)\ )
- [int](class_int.md) **get_width**\ (\ )

The width of the texture (in pixels). Higher values make it possible to represent high-frequency data better (such as sudden direction changes), at the cost of increased generation time and memory usage.
